item.title: 5 days left to grab rebooted ticket prices for TechCrunch Disrupt 2024
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description:
The countdown to TechCrunch Disrupt 2024 is on, and so are rebooted ticket prices! Save up to $600 on individual ticket types before September 27. Take advantage of these huge last-minute discounts while you still can. Disrupt 2024 is where the startup ecosystem converges. Taking place at Moscone West in San Francisco from October 28-30, […]

item.title: TikTok launches expanded subscriptions feature for creators
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
TikTok announced on Monday that its redesigned “Subscription” monetization offering is rolling out to eligible creators in select regions, including Brazil, France, Germany, Spain, the U.K., Indonesia, Italy, Japan, South Korea, and the U.S. The company says it plans to expand the feature to more markets in the coming weeks. The official rollout comes as […]

item.title: Pyka fields interest from defense as $40M round goes to scaling up its electric autonomous planes
item.dc:creator: Devin Coldewey
item.description:
Though it briefly worked on a passenger plane, the company decided after raising some money in 2022 that a cargo variant of the Pelican was more practical in the short term.

item.title: Cloudflare’s new marketplace will let websites charge AI bots for scraping
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
Cloudflare announced plans on Monday to launch a marketplace in the next year where website owners can sell AI model providers access to scrape their site’s content. The marketplace is the final step of Cloudflare CEO Matthew Prince’s larger plan to give publishers greater control over how and when AI bots scrape their websites. “If […]

item.title: Thor and Harbinger’s new hybrid RV will let you spend more time at the campsite
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description:
Legacy automakers are experiencing a sort of existential crisis as they grapple with whether to stick to plans to go all-electric or hedge with hybrids. This sudden appetite for options across the industry is creating opportunity for EV startups like Los Angeles’ Harbinger, which announced Monday that it has developed its first hybrid powertrain for […]

item.title: The new Reeder app is built for RSS, YouTube, Reddit, Mastodon and more
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
For the longest time, RSS readers have followed an “Inbox Zero” design philosophy by showing an unread count against each source. If you have more than a dozen feeds plugged into your RSS reader, good luck getting that to zero. Silvio Rizzi, the developer who built the popular RSS app Reeder, wants to cater to […]

item.title: Kestra raises another $8M for its open-source orchestration platform
item.dc:creator: Romain Dillet
item.description:
Data orchestration platform Kestra just raised an $8 million funding round led by Alven, with existing investors Isai and Axeleo participating once again.

item.title: David Energy is going up against Goliath energy incumbents
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description:
James McGinniss has been obsessed with decarbonization and the energy grid since he was a high schooler over a decade ago. Now, his startup David Energy has a lofty goal: getting the energy grid to run entirely on clean energy in the next 10 years. Brooklyn-based David Energy is a software-enabled retail energy provider. item.title: Jump raises $12M to help freelancers get benefits just like employees
item.dc:creator: Romain Dillet
item.description:
Jump offers full-time contracts to freelancers looking for some stability and the benefits involved with a full-time job.

item.title: SoftBank’s Masayoshi Son has been planning his comeback
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description:
A new Financial Times profile of Masayoshi Son opens with SoftBank’s CEO seeming to hit bottom, staring at his “ugly” face on Zoom and telling himself, “I have done nothing I can be proud of.” Indeed, Son largely disappeared from the public eye after SoftBank’s Vision Fund took huge losses from investments like WeWork. But […]

item.title: Matt Mullenweg calls WP Engine a ‘cancer to WordPress’ and urges community to switch providers
item.dc:creator: Paul Sawers
item.description:
Automattic CEO and WordPress co-creator Matt Mullenweg unleashed a scathing attack on a rival firm this week, calling WP Engine a “cancer to WordPress.” Mullenweg criticized the company — which has been commercializing the open source WordPress project since 2010 — for profiteering without giving much back, while also disabling key features that make WordPress […]

item.title: Synex founder, once detained at the border with an 80-pound magnet, is building portable MRIs to test glucose
item.dc:creator: Margaux MacColl
item.description:
Synex Medical just raised $21.8 million to build a portable MRI capable of testing glucose and other important molecules without the need to extract blood.

item.title: Yup, Jony Ive is working on an AI device startup with OpenAI
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description:
Jony Ive, the legendary designer who left his full-time role at Apple five years ago, is working on a new startup with OpenAI and its CEO Sam Altman. The collaboration was first reported last year, and Ive confirmed it in a New York Times profile about what he’s been up to since leaving Apple. If […]

item.title: Pedego’s Cargo e-bike: Sporty, stylish and powerful for $4,000

item.description:
The Pedego’s Cargo e-bike is marketed as a powerful and sporty ride that’s geared towards parents toting kids around town and anyone who needs to schlep heavy gear.  I spent the summer testing out this cargo e-bike to find out if it met that mission. My take: It’s a stylish ride that can hold plenty […]

item.description:
The IPO market has not roared back in 2024 as many investors hoped it would — not yet, at least.
